turns.body: It looks like you used the tag !<q> before your message. While this isn't a standard command in most chat systems, it could be intended to indicate a "quote" or a special type of input. If you meant to test quoting or a specific function, please let me know what you'd like to do, and I'll do my best to help! If you have another question or want to try something else, just let me know.

turns.raw_header: I see you used !<o> before your message. This syntax isn't standard in most chat platforms, but it might be your way of marking or categorizing messages (perhaps "o" stands for "output" or "option"?). If you're testing how I interpret these tags, I'm here to help!
turns.footer: Let me know if you want me to treat messages with !<o> differently, or if you have a specific function in mind for these tags. Otherwise, I'm ready to assist with any questions or tasks you have!

parsed_footer.raw: Let me know if you want me to treat messages with !<o> differently, or if you have a specific function in mind for these tags. Otherwise, I'm ready to assist with any questions or tasks you have!
